bio: Douglas Adams (born 19 January 1951) is an English writer, comedian, actor, and television presenter. He is best known for his work on the BBC science fiction television programme Doctor Who, for which he has been the Doctor since 1963, and for his radio series The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, which he has narrated since 1979. He has also written several other books, including the autobiographical The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul (1978), and the science fiction novel The Restaurant at the End of the Universe (1980).
